abstract: David Choe, a Korean-American muralist and graffiti tagger, is about to become part of the American 1 percent. In 2005, the bad-boy artist from Los Angeles was commissioned to paint murals at Facebook's corporate headquarters. As payment, although he thought Facebook was "ridiculous,'' he chose shares of stock. And now, in the wake of Facebook's public offering on Wednesday, he's on the verge of making $200 million.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG - David Choe grew up rough in Los Angeles, and there were some run-ins with the law that resulted in jail time. He claims to have been a looter during the L.A. riots in 1992. He did the cover art for a Linkin Park album, hopped freights in California and set out to hitchhike across China. His striking poster of President Obama (which is said to be hanging in the White House) has a hidden message that can only be seen by black light.
